content.text:
The 1Password item exists but uses a different field name. Let's find the correct field.

```bash
op item get "gemini-api-key" --account=my.1password.com
```

This will show you the available fields. Common alternatives are `credential`, `api_key`, `notesPlain`, or `key`. Once you see the field name, let me know and I'll update `.env.tpl`.

content.thinking:
This is very strange - the item exists when we query it directly with `op item get`, but `op inject` can't find it. Let me think about this...

The `op item list` shows the vault as "Private" but `op item get` shows it as "Personal". This is confusing. 

Wait - maybe the vault display name is "Private" but the internal name used by `op://` references is different. Let me look at the vault ID: `twpi32edvw57yxnbbh536li4wy`. In `op item get`, the vault is shown as `Personal (twpi32edvw57yxnbbh536li4wy)`.
 
So the same item is being reported with different vault names depending on which command I use - `op item list` calls it "Private" while `op item get` calls it "Personal". That's a real discrepancy, and it could mean the vault was renamed at some point or these commands are pulling from different sources.

I should have them list out their actual vaults to see what's really configured in their system.

content.text:
Something is inconsistent — `op item get` shows `Personal` but the item can't be found there. Let's check what vaults you actually have:

```bash
op vault list --account=my.1password.com
```

content.text:
The vault is actually named `Private` (ID `twpi32edvw57yxnbbh536li4wy`). The `op item get` display of "Personal" was the vault's description/category, not its name used in `op://` references.

So `op://Private/...` is correct after all. The issue must be that the item is deleted or archived despite appearing in `op item get`. Try restoring it:

```bash
op item get "openai-api-key" --vault=Private --account=my.1password.com
```

If that works, the item exists but may have been archived. Check the 1Password app and make sure the item is not in the "Recently Deleted" or "Archive" section — it needs to be fully active in the `Private` vault.

Let me revert `.env.tpl` back to `Private` for all three.
